activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:48 PM Defendant Nicholas L. Daniel in court by video in custody with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $500 with conditions.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim N.Y., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.
